Stem: Jordan adds some soil and plants to a large glass jar to build a terrarium (image shown below). He waters the plants and then adds two snails, two crickets, and an earthworm to the jar. Jordan then places the lid tightly on the jar and sets it on a sunny windowsill. Based on the law of conservation of mass, which of the following is expected to occur inside Jordan’s terrarium? Assume the total mass of the terrarium and everything within it is 2000g and that nothing can enter or escape it. Image credit: Joe Rees
Choices: A) The mass will neither increase nor decrease., B) The mass will increase as the earthworm digests the soil., C) The mass will decrease when the crickets die., D) The mass will increase as the plants grow and decrease when the snails eat the plants. Copper is a metal that is not distributed equally to all parts of Earth. The map below represents the locations of copper metal deposits on the planet and the locations of volcanic activity. Based on the map, select the two global locations most commonly associated with copper metal deposits.
Choices: A) near active volcanoes, B) in the middle of oceans, C) near tectonic plate boundaries, D) in the center of tectonic plates Select the statement that best describes the distribution of copper metal deposits on Earth.
Scenario Justification: Real-world scenario with visual component provides some context for reasoning.
SEP Justification: Requires prediction based on understanding — applies practice in context.
DCI Justification: Requires applying science understanding in context, beyond simple recall.
CCC Justification: Multiple CCCs implicitly engaged through the reasoning required.
Key Recommendation: Good question. Consider adding more complexity through novel data or multi-step reasoning.

Stem: Select the statement that best describes the distribution of copper metal deposits on Earth.

Scenario Justification: Minimal or no scenario. Question is straightforward recall or identification.
SEP Justification: No science practice engaged. Recall/identification only.
DCI Justification: Some content engagement in answer choices but limited reasoning with DCI.

This means that water use became c efficient after 1980. a b c increased increased more leveled decreased less Electromagnets are used to lift and move magnetic metals in recycling facilities. These metals may be sharp and very heavy, but with the use of an electromagnetic crane, the metal can be moved safely and easily. The team of students investigated the types of objects that were able to be lifted by the electromagnetic crane. The team of students observed that the crane was able to lift the car. When the electromagnet was placed on the more massive bus, the crane was not able to lift it. Which argument is supported by this evidence?
Choices: A) The gravitational force on the bus is greater than the gravitational force on the car but less than the magnetic force exerted by the crane., B) The gravitational force on the bus is greater than the gravitational force on the car and greater than the magnetic force exerted by the crane., C) The gravitational force on the bus is less than the gravitational force on the car but greater than the magnetic force exerted by the crane., D) The gravitational force on the bus is less than the gravitational force on the car and less than the magnetic force exerted by the crane. The diagram below represents parts of a human organ system.
Scenario Justification: Rich scenario with data and observable phenomenon requiring genuine sense-making.
SEP Justification: Requires analyzing data and constructing/evaluating evidence-based claims.
DCI Justification: DCI present but used at surface level — identification rather than reasoning.
CCC Justification: No CCC engagement. No patterns, cause/effect, or systems thinking required.
Key Recommendation: Push beyond recall — require students to reason with science ideas, not just identify them. Explicitly engage a crosscutting concept (cause/effect, patterns, systems, structure/function).
